description: Numbers n which are a factor of (LPP(n)-1)!, where LPP(n) is the largest prime power factor of n.
example: 18 is in the sequence since 9 is the largest prime power factor of 18 and 18 is a factor of (9-1)!=8!=40320=18*2240.
crossrefs: Cf. A002034, A034699, A057109, A057110. Distinct from A046790 although similar initial terms.
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Aug 08 2000
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Aug 22 2000
